title: Tyson Fury's promoter Frank Warren claims heavyweight star didn't discuss WWE clash with him
text:
Frank Warren has admitted that he isn't pleased with Tyson Fury's decision to plan a WWE fight without telling him.

Fury will make his wrestling debut when he takes on 6ft 8in Braun Strowman at the Crown Jewel showcase in Saudi Arabia on October 31.

The heavyweight boxer's decision came as a surprise to his promoter Warren, who said that Fury should be resting instead.

Tyson Fury didn't tell his promoter Frank Warren about his intention to take part in WWE

Warren admitted he is concerned Fury could suffer an injury that could harm his boxing career

Warren told talkSPORT: 'What can you say? He went out there to watch it and the next minute he's involved in it, it's unbelievable.

'But that's Tyson. He's supposed to be taking a rest and taking it easy, but he's decided that he wants to do this and he's going to do it…

'No he didn't [discuss it with me]. He's done it and we've discussed it afterwards.

'I'd be a liar if I said I was pleased with it, I'd prefer him not to do it but he's doing it.'

Fury will take on Braun Strowman at the Crown Jewel showcase in Saudi Arabia on October 31

Warren also admitted that he is concerned that Fury could be hurt and put his boxing career at risk.

Warren said: 'Listen, I've seen WWE fighters get cuts, it's the nature of contact sports.

'It could happen but I hope it doesn't. I'd prefer he didn't do it because it could jeopardise his boxing career.

'But he's doing it and he's his own man. In some ways I suppose it's keeping him focussed and keeping fit and well.

'It's not like he's a baby, he's 30 years of age.'

Fury is set to return to boxing next year with a rematch against Deontay Wilder

Last week Fury was a surprise guest at Smackdown, and, after trading verbal blows with Strowman, the pair were involved in a brawl.

Discussing his involvement in WWE, Fury said: 'I was a lifelong WWE fan and it is a fantastic opportunity for me to be here. I’m so excited to be fighting the monster among men, Braun Strowman.'

Fury's last boxing match was last month, when he defeated Otto Watlin. He is set to face Deontay Wilder in a rematch this year, with the previous bout between them in December 2018 having ended in a draw.
description: Frank Warren has admitted that he isn't pleased with Tyson Fury's decision to plan a WWE fight without telling him.
